alert.note: Alert for Clay; Grant; Kittson; Norman; West Marshall; West Otter Tail; West Polk; Wilkin (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Excessive Heat Watch issued June 17 at 10:21PM CDT until June 20 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Dangerously hot conditions with heat index values up to 108 possible. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and west central Minnesota and northeast and southeast North Dakota. * WHEN...From Sunday morning through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Be prepared to drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air- conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. This is especially true during warm or hot weather when car interiors can reach lethal temperatures in a matter of minutes.

area.areaDesc: Clay; Grant; Kittson; Norman; West Marshall; West Otter Tail; West Polk; Wilkin
